summary: This is a formal notification letter from the Warden of the Metropolitan Correctional Center to two federal judges, informing them of the death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide on August 10, 2019. It details the timeline of the incident, the response, and states that the FBI and DOJ Inspector General are investigating.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) at around 6:30 am from an apparent suicide. He was pronounced dead at New York Presbyterian-Lower Manhattan Hospital at 7:37 a.m.

events.title: Initiation of Investigations into Epstein's Death
events.description: The FBI and the Department of Justice Office of the Inspector General are activated to investigate the incident surrounding Epstein's death.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died on August 10, 2019, at approximately 7:37 a.m. at a New York hospital after being found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
His death was reported as an 'apparent suicide' and occurred while he was in the Special Housing Unit.
The FBI and the DOJ Office of the Inspector General were immediately tasked with investigating the incident.
An autopsy was pending at the time of the notification to determine the official cause of death.
The notification was sent to Chief Judge Colleen McMahon and District Judge Richard M. Berman, who were overseeing his case (19-cr-00490-RMB).
